refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkInfoBar implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkBuildable and GtkOrientable.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkInfoBar is a widget that can be used to show messages to the user without showing a dialog. It is often temporarily shown at the top or bottom of a document. In contrast to GtkDialog, which has a horizontal action area at the bottom, GtkInfoBar has a vertical action area at the side.

The API of GtkInfoBar is very similar to GtkDialog, allowing you to add buttons to the action area with gtk_info_bar_add_button() or gtk_info_bar_new_with_buttons(). The sensitivity of action widgets can be controlled with gtk_info_bar_set_response_sensitive(). To add widgets to the main content area of a GtkInfoBar, use gtk_info_bar_get_content_area() and add your widgets to the container.

Similar to GtkMessageDialog, the contents of a GtkInfoBar can by classified as error message, warning, informational message, etc, by using gtk_info_bar_set_message_type(). GTK+ uses the message type to determine the background color of the message area.

refsect2.title: GtkInfoBar as GtkBuildable
refsect2.para: The GtkInfoBar implementation of the GtkBuildable interface exposes the content area and action area as internal children with the names "content_area" and "action_area".

GtkInfoBar supports a custom <action-widgets> element, which can contain multiple <action-widget> elements. The "response" attribute specifies a numeric response, and the content of the element is the id of widget (which should be a child of the dialogs action_area).

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_new_with_buttons ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkInfoBar with buttons. Button text/response ID pairs should be listed, with a NULL pointer ending the list. Button text can be either a stock ID such as GTK_STOCK_OK, or some arbitrary text. A response ID can be any positive number, or one of the values in the GtkResponseType enumeration. If the user clicks one of these dialog buttons, GtkInfoBar will emit the "response" signal with the corresponding response ID.

listitem.simpara: stock ID or text to go in first button, or NULL
response ID for first button, then additional buttons, ending with NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_add_action_widget ()
refsect2.para: Add an activatable widget to the action area of a GtkInfoBar, connecting a signal handler that will emit the "response" signal on the message area when the widget is activated. The widget is appended to the end of the message areas action area.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_add_button ()
refsect2.para: Adds a button with the given text (or a stock button, if button_text is a stock ID) and sets things up so that clicking the button will emit the "response" signal with the given response_id. The button is appended to the end of the info bars's action area. The button widget is returned, but usually you don't need it.

listitem.simpara: text of button, or stock ID
the button widget that was added

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_add_buttons ()
refsect2.para: Adds more buttons, same as calling gtk_info_bar_add_button() repeatedly. The variable argument list should be NULL-terminated as with gtk_info_bar_new_with_buttons(). Each button must have both text and response ID.

listitem.simpara: response ID for first button, then more text-response_id pairs, ending with NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_set_response_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Calls gtk_widget_set_sensitive (widget, setting) for each widget in the info bars's action area with the given response_id. A convenient way to sensitize/desensitize dialog buttons.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_set_default_response ()
refsect2.para: Sets the last widget in the info bar's action area with the given response_id as the default widget for the dialog. Pressing "Enter" normally activates the default widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_response ()
refsect2.para: Emits the 'response' signal with the given response_id.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_set_message_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the message type of the message area. GTK+ uses this type to determine what color to use when drawing the message area.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_get_message_type ()
refsect2.para: Returns the message type of the message area.

listitem.simpara: the message type of the message area.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_get_action_area ()
refsect2.para: Returns the action area of info_bar.

refsect2.title: gtk_info_bar_get_content_area ()
refsect2.para: Returns the content area of info_bar.

refsect2.title: The "message-type" property
refsect2.para: The type is used to determine the colors to use in the info bar. The following symbolic color names can by used to customize these colors: "info_fg_color", "info_bg_color", "warning_fg_color", "warning_bg_color", "question_fg_color", "question_bg_color", "error_fg_color", "error_bg_color". "other_fg_color", "other_bg_color".
If the type is GTK_MESSAGE_OTHER, no info bar is painted but the colors are still set.

refsect2.title: The "action-area-border" style property
refsect2.para: Width of the border around the action area of the info bar.

refsect2.title: The "button-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: Spacing between buttons in the action area of the info bar.

refsect2.title: The "content-area-border" style property
refsect2.para: The width of the border around the content content area of the info bar.

refsect2.title: The "content-area-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: The default spacing used between elements of the content area of the info bar.

refsect2.title: The "close" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkInfoBar *arg0, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::close signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user uses a keybinding to dismiss the info bar.
The default binding for this signal is the Escape key.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "response" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkInfoBar *info_bar, gint response_id, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when an action widget is clicked or the application programmer calls gtk_dialog_response(). The response_id depends on which action widget was clicked.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
